Package br.com.kirgh.app.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
br.com.kirgh.app.controllers.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/v1/users", produces="application/json") public class UserController extends Object
The UserController class defines a REST API endpoint for creating a new user by taking in a validated userDTO object and returning a ResponseEntity.

  • Method Details

    • userRegister

      @PostMapping(consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> userRegister(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserDTO userDTO)
      This is a Java function that creates a new user by taking in a validated userDTO object and returns a ResponseEntity.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - userDTO is an object of the class UserDTO which is annotated with @Valid to indicate that the object should be validated before processing. It is passed as a request body in a POST request to the userRegister() method. The method then calls the createUser() method of the userService object and returns the
      Returns:
      The method userRegister is returning a ResponseEntity object, which can contain any type of response data along with an HTTP status code. The actual response data being returned depends on the implementation of the createUser method in the userService object.

    • getFilteredUsers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<User>> getFilteredUsers(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @RequestParam Map<String,String> filters)
      This function retrieves a paginated list of users based on specified filters and returns it as a JSON response.
      Parameters:
      pageable - The pageable parameter is used for pagination and sorting. It allows you to specify the page number, page size, and sorting criteria for the returned list of users.
      filters - A map containing the filters for searching. The keys in the map represent the filter criteria, and the values represent the filter values.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with a JSON response body containing a Page<User> object.

    • getAllUserInfoById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> getAllUserInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id)
      This function retrieves user information by their ID and returns a JSON response with the user's info.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of a user.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the HTTP status code 200 (OK) and the user's information in the response body.

    • getAllAddressesBoundUser

      @GetMapping("/{id}/addresses") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserCompleteInfoDTO> getAllAddressesBoundUser(@PathVariable UUID id)
      This function retrieves all addresses associated with a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of a user.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the status code 200 (OK) and the body containing a UserCompleteInfoDTO object.

    • updateUserInfoById

      @PutMapping(path="/{id}", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> updateUserInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserUpdateDTO userUpdateDTO)
      This function updates a user's information and returns a JSON response with the new user's info.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the user to be updated.
      userUpdateDTO - The userUpdateDTO is a data transfer object that contains the updated information for the user. It is annotated with @Valid to perform validation on the request body. The fields in the userUpdateDTO include:
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the updated User object in the body. The HTTP status code of the response is 200 (OK).

    • deleteUserById

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteUserById(@NonNull @PathVariable @NonNull UUID id)
      This function is used to delete a user by their ID and return a JSON response with a success message.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity<String> object.
